title: I LOVE LISTS
description: I LOVE LISTS I don’t understand the Trader Joe’s bag hype. Are you panic buying? What are the best Val Kilmer movies? I had ChatGPT turn me into an action figure this week. Our chips are getting beefy here in America. Let’s look at incredible weather photos. This is why I like having friends over to make art. I would love to play around in these light installations. Did you see how much you can see of the Titanic now?? WOW. Do you also like optical illusions? How to tell if your eggs are bad. Why do professional painters wear white? I can’t believe we had torpedo bras. Pins for your book loving friend: one / two / three Are you following food trends? A TJs employee discusses the best products of all time. Here are my favorite Tjs staples & beauty products. Did you get into sourdough bread during the pandemic? I even started making sourdough pizza! Weekend treats: Chocolate Coconut Chia Pudding Help me Help YOU! Here’s 40% off your first Thrive Market order. – I saved $500 last year! Buy something from my Etsy shop! You help me pay for my health insurance while you’re working on a planner! Use my affiliate link to get a free month of Skillshare premium! Want extra discounts and cashback on online purchases? I use Rakuten religiously! Are you on Substack? Follow me!! Check out The Handwriting Club Substack. I share all of my handwriting adventures there. For paid subscribers, I’ve been hosting private zoom calls where we can go over our currently workbooks/and journal together. There are also some free printables in the mix. I am also still running Self-Check-In. I moved it over to Substack! If you need accountability and a dedicated time/space to complete work for the week ahead, join us! We meet Sundays 9-10:30AM PST! The post I LOVE LISTS appeared first on Shutterbean.
excerpt: I Love Lists is a weekly roundup of the best links from around the internet, curated by Tracy Benjamin of Shutterbean. Discover inspiring reads, creative ideas, delicious recipes, and fun finds every week!
text: Jamie April 11, 2025 I haven’t seen the TJs mini bags yet, but I also don’t have a lot of FOMO energy that makes me seek them out. Same with Stanley mugs, or the latest, greatest of just about anything. But if I find the mini totes at my local TJs, do you want one? LOL Reply
html:
Jamie April 11, 2025

I haven’t seen the TJs mini bags yet, but I also don’t have a lot of FOMO energy that makes me seek them out. Same with Stanley mugs, or the latest, greatest of just about anything. But if I find the mini totes at my local TJs, do you want one? LOL

Reply
